clinical_study.brief_title: Transversus Abdominis Plane Block in Pediatrics: Volume or Concentration ?
clinical_study.official_title: Volume or Concentration for the Transverse Abdominal Plane Block in Children Aged 1-5 Years: Analgesic Effects and Safety

brief_summary.textblock: The transversus abdominis plane (TAP) block provide a local anesthesia drug diffusion between the transverse abdominis muscle and the internal oblique muscle. TAP block reaches the anterior rami of spinal nerves from T7 to L1 involved in the innervation of homolateral abdominal wall. The transversus abdominis plane block has shown promise for perioperative analgesia, but data on the optimal dose regimen are limited.Following previous research of optimal dose of local anesthesic solution, the investigators aim to evaluate if a "volume effect" would lead to a better diffusion of the local anesthesic solution to the overall nervous roots. The local anesthesia drug choosen is levobupivacaine with a unique posology of 0,4 mg/kg (either 0,2 ml/kg of 0,2% levobupivacaine for "small volume" group or 0,4 ml/kg of 0,1% levobupivacaine for "high volume" group).With the same dose of levobupivacaine, this study aims to assess the impact of volume effect on analgesia efficiency as well as the security as after ultrasound TAP block on one to five years' old children who undergo a peritoneal-vaginal duct surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: number of patients for whom a rescue analgesia was necessary in post anesthesia care unit and ambulatory surgery unit
primary_outcome.time_frame: from arrival in post anesthesia care unit until discharge (An expected average of 4 hours after end of surgery)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: for time of surgery (1 to 4 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Post operative pain (FLACC scale) at hospital
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from recovery room until discharge (An expected average of 4 hours after end of surgery)
secondary_outcome.description: Post operative pain is evaluated every 15 minutes in the recovery room and then every two hours in the ambulatory surgical unit until discharge at home.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasmatique peak of levobupivacaine (Cmax in µg/ml)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 min until 75 min after injection of local anaesthetic

secondary_outcome.measure: Time necessary to reach plasmatique peak of levobupivacaine (tmax in min)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 min until 75 min after injection of local anaesthetic

secondary_outcome.measure: Complications related to local analgesia procedure
secondary_outcome.description: cardiovascular adverse event, adverse vascular ponction (positive aspiration test for blood), adverse peritoneal ponction, hematoma

secondary_outcome.measure: First request of rescue antalgic (Nubain or Tramadol)
Pain evaluation at home by parents (score PPMP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: call between 24 and 48 hours in post operative

arm_group.description: Local analgesia by one injection of 0,2 ml/kg of 0,2% lévobupivacaine
Local analgesia by one injection of 0,4 ml/kg of 0,1% lévobupivacaine

intervention.intervention_name: Injection of 0,2 ml/kg of 0,2% levobupivacaine for small volume group
intervention.description: Ultrasound guided administration of 0,2 ml/kg of 0,2% lévobupivacaine in the plane between the internal oblique and transversus abdominis muscles

intervention.intervention_name: Injection of 0,4 ml/kg of 0,1% lévobupivacaine for high volume group
intervention.description: Ultrasound guided administration of 0,4 ml/kg of 0,1% lévobupivacaine in the plane between the internal oblique and transversus abdominis muscles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalisation in ambulatory surgery and anesthesia unit for surgery of inguinal hernia or ovarian hernia or hydrocele or cord kyst
- Overall status: ASA I-II
- Aged from 1 to 5 years
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Coagulation trouble
- Infection on ponction zone
- Local anesthesia drug or nonsteroidal anti inflammatory intolerance
- Cardiac/Renal/hepacticdysfunction
- Hemorrage, digestive perforation history
